DataElement.preferredName: Study Protocol Document Version Or Science Technique Description ISO21090.ST.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The textual summary of a document that includes extended scientific or technical information.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Study Protocol Document Version Or Science Technique Description
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The formal plan of an experiment or research activity, including the objective, rationale, design, materials and methods for the conduct of the study; intervention description, and method of data analysis.:An organized collection of records that describe a particular body of work.:A form or variant of a type or original; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:The intellectual and practical activity encompassing the systematic study of the structure and behaviour of the physical and natural world through observation and experiment.:A practiced and regimented skill or series of actions.:A written or verbal account, representation, statement, or explanation of something.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The formal plan of an experiment or research activity, including the objective, rationale, design, materials and methods for the conduct of the study; intervention description, and method of data analysis.:An organized collection of records that describe a particular body of work.:A form or variant of a type or original; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications.

Concepts.definition: The formal plan of an experiment or research activity, including the objective, rationale, design, materials and methods for the conduct of the study; intervention description, and method of data analysis.
A physical object, or electronic counterpart, that is characterized by containing writing which is meant to be human-readable.
A form or variant of a type or original; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications.

Property.preferredDefinition: An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:The intellectual and practical activity encompassing the systematic study of the structure and behaviour of the physical and natural world through observation and experiment.:A practiced and regimented skill or series of actions.:A written or verbal account, representation, statement, or explanation of something.

Concepts.definition: An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
The intellectual and practical activity encompassing the systematic study of the structure and behaviour of the physical and natural world through observation and experiment.
A practiced and regimented skill or series of actions.
A written or verbal account, representation, statement, or explanation of something.
